project.name: J-C832A-CMUD-05-ST02-DT01-DF18-CF16-01
project.description: This test takes a string. It locks a lock upon encountering the first a/A in the string, using one lock for lower case a and a different lock for upper case A. Upon encountering a second a/A in the string, it unlocks the lower case lock. If an A appears before an a, then the lock is unlocked without previously being locked, resulting in an exception.

iopair.name: J-C832A-CMUD-05-ST02-DT01-DF18-CF16-01-GOOD-01
iopair.description: register a character, become an archon (essentially a superuser), destroy character Environment variable defining string value.

process.script: dd if=/dev/urandom count=1 bs=512 2> /dev/null | tr -dc 'a-zA-Z0-9' | fold -w 5 | head -1 >/tmp/screen_name.txt; cat /tmp/screen_name.txt

sleep 22 && screen -dmSL ${SS_SCREEN_NAME//[$'\t\r\n ']} "$SS_TC_DEPS/bin/tt++" "$SS_TC_ROOT/testData/good-01/good_01.tin"; while [[ `screen -ls` == *${SS_SCREEN_NAME//[$'\t\r\n ']}* ]]; do sleep 1; done;
kill $(ps aux | grep 'coffee_mud' | grep -v 'grep' | awk '{print $2}'); echo "Killed coffee_mud"; date

scoring_formula.formula: GOOD-01-01 AND GOOD-01-02 AND GOOD-01-03 AND NOT TIMEOUT AND NOT CONTROLLED_EXIT
